newsitem.title: LATVIA: RIGA SHIPYARD TO MEET NOMURA OFFICIALS.
newsitem.headline: RIGA SHIPYARD TO MEET NOMURA OFFICIALS.

text.p: Riga Shipyard said on Monday that it would meet officials from securities house Nomura and the two sides would discuss a possible investment.
"We will meet representatives of Nomura on July 29," Eriks Kazha, the company's board chairman, told a news conference.
He said the contact was generated by a Baltic capital markets' conference in Stockholm in June.
"We must see if the talks produce a solution interesting to the company," said Shipyard president Vasilii Melnik.
Nomura said the meeting should be seen in the same category as the type of talks it holds with leading companies in the Baltics as an update and disscussion on possible projects.

"No particular project (with Riga Shipyard) has been decided on or prepared in any detail," Klaus Mansfeldt, the director of Nomura's central and eastern Europe division, told Reuters by telephone from London.
